title: Mauricio Pochettino: Don't judge Spurs' summer signings yet - they need time to show their quality
text:
Mauricio Pochettino has said that Tottenham Hotspur’s new signings will need at least 18 months, or even two years, before they can regularly produce their best football for the club.

Record signing Tanguy Ndombele, who arrived from Lyon this summer for around £55 million, delivered an exceptional performance in Tottenham’s midweek victory over Red Star Belgrade but Pochettino said it is still too early to assess the midfielder’s form.

Pochettino pointed to the improvements made by Son Heung-min and Moussa Sissoko as proof that players need time to adapt to life at Tottenham, and said the same applies to new arrivals Giovani Lo Celso and Ryan Sessegnon.

“For me, when you sign a player, despite the amount you pay, with the profile of Tanguy Ndombele or Giovani Lo Celso or Ryan Sessegnon you need minimum one year and a half, or two years,” said Pochettino.

“Look at what happened with Son or Sissoko, they started to perform in year two, year three. Today the market is the market. You cannot judge the player because you paid some kind of amount. He [Ndombele] played two years in Lyon and moved to England where everything is new, but the quality is there. They need time to show their real quality.”
